H0.text: Students performing a scientific investigation are most likely trying to produce a new theory.

H1.text: Disproving a hypothesis is what students performing a scientific investigation are most likely trying to do.

H2.text: Reject a conclusion is what students performing a scientific investigation are most likely trying to do.

H3.text: Answering a question is what students performing a scientific investigation are most likely trying to do.

A4.text: The systematic, careful collection of measurements or counts of relevant quantities is often the critical difference between pseudo-sciences, such as alchemy, and science, such as chemistry or biology.

A5.text: When applying the scientific method to research, determining a good question can be very difficult and it will affect the outcome of the investigation.
